comments.body: I believe we used to get away with not having rapidjson available in our arrow build since we set {{ARROW_IPC}} to {{OFF}}.  I'm not sure when this was introduced but I ran into this while integrating 0.14.1 into our build system.  I think a simple fix is to only build the {{arrow/json}} sources when {{ARROW_WITH_RAPIDJSON}} is true.

If we wanted to make JSON optional, then we would need a dedicated CMake feature flag such as {{-DARROW_JSON=on}}.

But currently we need JSON for many tests internally, so passing {{-DARROW_JSON=off}} should fail when unit tests or integration tests are enabled.

I've posted a PR which restores the previous behavior of JSON being a sort-of optional component.  I like the idea of adding a {{ARROW_JSON}} option.  This would match up with how Parquet and ORC are currently handled.  Would it be ok to treat making JSON a real optional component as a separate issue?
I'd rather have this done as part of this issue. There is no reason to merge an emergency fix, especially as we're not releasing immediately.

It's strange. Because we use bundled RapidJSON when we can't find system RapidJSON. If we specify {{-DRappidJSON_SOURCE=SYSTEM}} and there is no system RapidJSON, {{cmake}} must reports error. So we can't build Arrow.
